intro: Gongronema multibracteolatum, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Urticaceae family, characterized by its stinging hairs on the leaves and stems. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, round berries that are edible when ripe. Gongronema multibracteolatum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
